shortDescription: Daily pushup practice for upper body strength, functional fitness, and discipline
scientificBenefits: Increased chest, shoulder, and tricep strength
Enhanced bone density in arms and wrists
Better functional strength for daily activities
Cardiovascular health benefits (when done in volume)

researchCitations.study: Yang et al. (2019) - JAMA Network Open
researchCitations.finding: Men able to do 40+ pushups have 96% lower cardiovascular disease risk

researchCitations.study: Dhahbi et al. (2018) - International Journal of Sports Physiology and Performance
researchCitations.finding: 8-week pushup training increases upper body strength by 45% in beginners

researchCitations.study: Gottschall et al. (2013) - Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research
researchCitations.finding: Pushups activate 50+ muscles simultaneously, making them highly efficient

commonBarriers: Can't do a full pushup yet (need modifications)
Wrist or shoulder pain from poor form
progressionPlan: Week 1-2: Start where you are (wall/knee pushups if needed), 10-15 reps daily. Week 3-4: 20-30 regular pushups, focus on form. Week 5-8: 40-50+ pushups, add variations (wide, diamond, decline), progressive sets.
nooLifeFeatureHighlight: Track daily pushup count. Watch rep progression over time. GTA-style upper body strength visuals. Contributes to Strength and Discipline ratings. Celebrate personal records.
testimonial: "Could barely do 10 pushups. NooLife tracked my daily progress. Day 66: 60 straight. Numbers don't lie." - Jenna F.
ctaAngle: Build upper body strength with daily pushup tracking. Free 3-day trial.
